Loved watching this in theaters. The story is no more original than James Cameron's Pocahontas (lol), but the visuals were worth forking out some fifteen bucks to see.

I don't see how you people can say the quality of this rip is outstanding. This shit looks like something off of a cellphone, and the audio is off a smidgen but recognizable nonetheless. Not to mention a guy walks up and out right in front of the camera (which, however, is expected because it's not from a DVD anyway). It's 'average' at the most, and viewable - but certainly not something I can enjoy.

I will be buying this on Blu-ray, regardless of the fact that I don't even have a Blu-ray player. Ha
